verdict.summary: Service has no matching pods — selector doesn't match any pod labels, or pods aren't ready.

dead_ends.action: Removing the selector from the Service
dead_ends.why_fails: Creates a Service with no backends; all requests fail
Fragile; must be manually updated when pods change

workarounds.action: Verify selectors match: kubectl get pods --selector=app=myapp
workarounds.how: Service selector must match pod labels exactly

workarounds.action: Check if pods are Ready: kubectl get pods -o wide — unready pods aren't added to endpoints
workarounds.how: Pods must pass readiness probes to receive traffic

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'endpoints for service not found' indicates a missing or endpoint-less Kubernetes Service, while 'from server (Forbidden)' indicates RBAC permission denial for a service account.
'endpoints for service not found' indicates a missing or endpoint-less Kubernetes Service, while 'Pod status' indicates a pod evicted due to resource pressure.
